intro: Erythroxylum triloculare, commonly known as the three-chambered erythroxylum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Erythroxylaceae. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in regions of Mexico, Guatemala, and parts of the Amazon basin. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that typically contains three chambers, giving the species its scientific name. Erythroxylum triloculare is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
